page.title: 18OUR SCHOOL NOW
page.content: In July 1985 there are 24 pupils, aged between 4 and 11, attending Ireby School. The teaching staff are:- a headteacher, one full time assistant teacher, a part time assistant teacher who teaches one afternoon a week and a peripatetic music teacher who comes for one hour a week to teach recorders. Non teaching staff are:- a caretaker, cook-in-charge, general kitchen assistant, midday supervisor and a part time clerical assistant. School times are 9.00 a.m._ 12 noon; 1.00 p.m._ 3.15 (infants)/ 3.30 p.m. (juniors). Under the government's Education Support Grants scheme Ireby School is taking part in a project to "Enrich the curriculum in small rural schools". This begins in Sept.1985 and lasts for 5 years linking Ireby, Uldale, Caldbeck, Hesket Newmarket and Bassenthwaite schools.
